summary: Built automated .NET/C# data-integration services feeding Power BI for Air Force infrastructure management; learned C# and .NET on the job and delivered production features within weeks.
specifics: Designed a C#/.NET pipeline to consume external APIs, normalize facility inspection records, and sync into SQL databases with schema optimizations for Power BI report performance.
Implemented automated request batching and caching logic to reduce redundant third-party API calls while maintaining data freshness requirements.
Integrated with AWS-hosted services and Power BI Embedded for real-time Air Force infrastructure monitoring dashboards.
Refactored dashboard layouts in collaboration with Air Force analysts to improve report clarity for facility condition tracking and predictive maintenance.
Recognized with a 2026 return offer for rapid technical adaptability and production-quality delivery despite minimal prior C# and .NET experience.

company: Liu Idea Lab for Innovation & Entrepreneurship (Rice)
summary: Conducted extensive user research and product strategy for Rice's entrepreneurship platform, combining UX design with technical prototyping to inform curriculum improvements and founder support programs.
specifics: Conducted 40+ user interviews with student founders and faculty to identify key needs in entrepreneurship education, resource access, and technical support gaps.
Designed and prototyped full-stack platform concepts in React, TypeScript, and Supabase, creating mockups and wireframes for course management, venture tracking, and mentorship tools.
Met weekly with 30+ student startup teams to understand technical and operational challenges, providing insights to faculty on curriculum enhancements.

Collaborated with professors to design software-focused entrepreneurship coursework, taking multiple entrepreneurship classes to better understand student founder perspectives and inform program improvements.

summary: Built production-ready laytime calculation PoC in 1-week sprint under critical client deadline, reducing client's manual 3-day workflows to 8 minutes and directly enabling major strategic partnership.
specifics: Parsed PDFs/EMLs/XLSX and nested attachments at scale (100+ docs per batch) using Google Document AI with parallel execution, automating extraction of Statement of Facts, Charter Parties, and 15+ maritime document types.

Implemented rule engines that codified complex client-specific laytime clauses from contract documents, cross-checking vendor demurrage calculations against computed results for accuracy verification.

Served as primary technical consultant between client representatives, product teams, and engineering, conducting daily requirement sessions to ensure PoC met all contractual specifications under tight 1-week deadline.

Delivered interactive Streamlit demonstrations and initiated IMOS platform integration, completing production handoff to engineering team ahead of client expectations, with strategic agreement signed one month post-internship.

summary: Shipped NLP clustering and entity-matching pipelines (Sentence Transformers + FAISS) achieving ~97% title-category accuracy; improved company merge precision >20%.
specifics: Built job-title classifier using SentenceTransformer embeddings; tuned thresholds and stop-word handling for noisy maritime data.
Designed FAISS-based similarity search to merge 600k+ companies; improved matching precision by >20% versus legacy methods.
Automated an ingestion/cleaning pipeline to refresh leads and segmentation; cut outreach cycle time ~70%.
Partnered with PMs to productize insights and tighten feedback loops into roadmap decisions.

summary: One of three frontend iOS devs on Veson’s first mobile app; enabled on-the-go access to voyage/cargo data and drove broad client adoption.
specifics: Built Swift UI features, API client, and offline-tolerant data flows; coordinated sprint integration with the platform team.
Presented builds to enterprise users; incorporated feedback for usability and reliability improvements.
Introduced >50% of surveyed clients to mobile workflows; reduced time-to-data by ~30% versus desktop access.
Established CI/CD hygiene and release rituals with Atlassian tooling.
